title: Rotational work - torsional spring rotates rod

content.question: Which of the following is a correct expression for <math alttext="omega sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mi>ω</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </mstyle> </math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 kappa times theta sub 0, end sub, cubed, and denominator 3 I sub R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>κ</mi><msubsup><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>3</mn></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 times the square root of the fraction with numerator kappa times theta sub 0, end sub, cubed, and denominator I sub R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mi>κ</mi><msubsup><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>3</mn></msubsup></mrow><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 times the square root of the fraction with numerator kappa times theta sub 0, end sub, cubed, and denominator 3 I sub R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mi>κ</mi><msubsup><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>3</mn></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 times the square root of the fraction with numerator kappa times theta sub 0, end sub, cubed, and denominator 3 I sub R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mi>κ</mi><msubsup><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>3</mn></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
